reviews.sentence: New Year Celebration. My partner and I celebrate New Year in the Rancho Mirage area and had one of the best new year celebration the hotel has a great location close to restaurants and bars the view from the hotel was outstanding overlooking the snow mountains. The room had kitchen and all appliances at our finger tips very expacious the bedroom had a nice balcony with a great view. We love this hotel. only the check out time might be too early. Center location close to restaurants bars and casinos. We love this hotel definately will stay again.

Great location good facility but noisy. we have stayed here before and found it to be a good overall experience. Friendly staff nice pool and facilities rooms in good condition and well appointed. Stayed in the Tamarisk Bldg. on the second floor this time and found the noise from the road very distracting and it interrupted our sleep several times. The location is quite central but you need to have a car as nothing is within walking distance. Would stay again only if we could stay in another building. Central location nice pool and other facilities. Rooms have been renovated and are perfect for up to 4 people. The noise from nearby Cathedral Canyon Dr is loud day and night. Need to plant trees or something to block the noise or upgrade the windows. If you have a car the location is good. We did some hiking in Palm Springs and Palm Desert and also some geocaching nearby.

Never had a complaint. Always a good experience. On last 2 visits room was overlooking golf course with views of the mountain. Have visited the resort many times never had any problems. Adequate utensils good size accommodation. Would highly recommend this facility. Know we will return there again.
We stayed in a 2nd floor villa we had wifi beautiful room great bed and glorious AC. The pool was enjoyable especially at night but the activities room left a bit to be desired.

Its a cozy resort with fewer amenities then there san diego location. There rooms floir plan is spacious and equipped with a little kitchen it includes stovetop dishwasher refrigerator kitchen utensils and a few small appliances.

Clean and comfortable. My children and I were pleased with the Desert Oasis. The unit was well equipped with newer appliances and my children were able to sleep three deep in the queen sized bed. The sleeper sofa was newer and also comfortable. Do not get excited about the fitness center as it was small and limited in equipment. However there were a couple of pool tables and a ping pong table.
Spacious. Great space great bed clean rooms. Beautiful view of mountains. Amenities were nice. Good central location.

Quiet comfortable and well equiped suite. We chose this place for it is central location as we were visiting elderly relatives in Banning and Palm Desert. Although not ultra modern in this spacious two room suite everything was functioning bed was very comfortable and we were on the upper floor only two levels high. The spacious south facing balcony overlooked the golf course and the mountains and had sun virtually all day and hardly any noise from the surroundings. The grounds were well maintained and the two pools were of a good size and reasonably warm. There is a snack bar bar by the polside lounging area. Sun loungers are good quality and free towels are issued from the games room which also has pool tables and table tennis. The reception area is very welcoming and there is free coffee in the foyer in the mornings. All the staff were very helpful and cheery. I played a few rounds of golf on the adjacent course which was in reasonably good condition considering the time of year. I was on a few occasions scooping small roaches up and throwing them outside it is a hot climate and the room is not hermetically sealed you can not prevent this at all times we take the conditions as they come. I would stay here again if I was visiting in the future.

Very nice hotel. When my wife and I booked this accommodation we thought we were booking a hotel room. Imagine our surprise when we walked into a very nice one bedroom suite complete with appliances dishes and cooking utensils. It was so nice to be able to have toast and coffee in the morning without having to go out. All staff that we had contact with were very friendly and helpful. Over all a very pleasant stay especially for a price that was less than many hotel rooms. Thank yo Welk Resorts.

The rooms are comfortable it is always been quiet despite the fact there are families with small children. Our room had a view of the mountains this time simply beautiful. we have stayed a couple of times and have had consistent pleasant experiences.

Total disappointment. From the cheesy pool cafe to the neglected activity center the cockroach we found in the room. I really think they should have a nice sit down restaurant instead of ordering from the pool cafe and taking it to go or having to eat outside in 115 °. I signed up for an activity only to be informed that it was canceled because they did not have staff that had been trained working that day. Another activity they were not the least bit ready for was the making a succulent garden. I chose 3 plants out of the 9 available luckily the other people decided not to do it but they only had 6 plants to choose from. We attended the Welk resort owner meeting where they show you all the good things you would get from becoming an owner. luckily we had no intention since they scheduled that meeting early the furst day before we were totally disappointed wuth the resort. I have stayed at their Welk resort in Branson and at first the Palm Springs resort seemed better. that opinion did not last long.

Recnt visit. Good property. Some items in room need update. Great staff and service. When an issue arose one call and problem solved. We had two minor issues one with closet door and one with lamp. One call and done. The unit we were in was away from pool and was quite and comfortable.

Rooms are pretty dated carpets are old and worn out. Amenities are ok swimming pool is nothing to brag about and activity center is average at best. Most of the staff at this resort was generally good and helpful except for one person at the front desk that was rude and was refusing to give a 11 AM checkout although I was given the 1 hour leeway at the time of checkin.

The unit above us had young children and the noise from banging doors and the kids running all over for hous was too much. The unit was nice but needed some upgrades. I would not stay again just because of the noise from the upper units.

Never stay here again by myself. The pool area was noisy but I heard they had an adult pool that was not on the map. The unit was clean but they never told me they changed your towels out mid week which would have been nice. The resort is not secure. The doors to hallways from street can be accessed by anyone poor lighting next to pot store and strip club Never saw a security person. Also back patio door is easily broken in to. Used coffee table to secure door from inside. Staff told me wrong date when I called to confirm my last night and never informed me that you needed a laundry card when checking in or that they had activities for guests or did I get a map of the property until I asked for it.

Not memorable. Heads up you ’l get a 100 fee to use the Internet and pool when you arrive. This place was just so much smaller than I thought it would be. From the pictures it did disappoint. The pool was crowded and a third of the pool was blocked off by concrete or a large bench. Many people would save chairs for half the day and never show up. There were probably only 20 chairs that are polside. I recommend they add more water stations. I recommend fresh fruit inside the water coolers. I recommend they offer cream or real half and half at the coffee station in the lobby. I recommended they play more music at the pool it was quiet for a day or two. This place just needs more personality. Our ground floor unit 507 was facing the parking lot and street so we did n’t sit outside much. Bummer. I thought it would be awesome but it just was n’t.

not worth the price. This can not be a Welks Resort it really needs improving I understand all resorts have fees but this was not worth it not once that our room get cleaned and yes we remove the paper from the door the TV in the living room was not working it kept saying no signal when I called customer service on the phone no one answered and the view from our balcony it is not the same as what they have on their pictures it is not a golf course but a sand dunes for off roading either it was a lake or Pond or of golf course it just looks bad.

Its a resort type property experience. Its kinda of run down. Not very clean. Check in was at 4 pm we waited until 5 pm and the room still was not ready. That was upsetting along with food on the floors in the hall and the hair in the bed. This hotel makes you check out at 10 am and the whole time we were there they used the excuse. the cochela music festival is here this weekend as a reason for everything they lacked. They should know not every guest is here for that or cares about that and it should not inconvenience our stay because of it.

The worst part about this place is that they will call you text you and harass you in person to go to a TIME SHARE PRESENTATION. Nothing on Expedia mentions that is part of the deal. The property had multiple wasps nests. Every time you walk outside there are wasps on the doors leading to the outside. One got in our room. We also found an earwig in our bed. Not only will I never stay here again I will never book through Expedia since they never mentioned that this was a time share property that would harass the guests even after they declined the presentation via text after 3 phone calls. They also did not give the advertised VIP benefits and Expedia claimed they were not a VIP hotel even though I have an email from Expedia saying they were. This hotel is run down the pool is dirty the rec room is dirty and this experience was horrible.
